author: rbb
msg: Move more code from the http module into the core server.  This
is core code, basically the default handler, the default input
and output filters, and all of the core configuration directives.
All of this code is required in order for the server to work, with or
without HTTP.  The server is closer to working without the HTTP
module, although there is still more to do.
I tried to fix Windows, but somebody should probably make sure I did
it correctly.

author: wrowe
msg: Protect the ALLUSERS flag from changing if the Product is already installed.

author: wrowe
msg: En masse cleanup of the cruft.
Pulled the [SERVICENAME] arg from the RegLocator table, since the
'service name' is really the 'display name' (with spaces) while the
RegKey must be space stripped!  This wasn't a problem for 'Apache',
but will become a problem for a service named 'Apache 2.0'.  Also,
Quoted the [SERVICENAME] to assure the shell cmds work.

author: trawick
msg: mention the changes to Apache for PR #6980

author: trawick
msg: Use a proper prototype for ap_show_directives() and ap_show_modules() so
that they match their prototypes in http_config.h.
